contextId.information: The words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that he is sincere as he makes his request. Solomon refers to himself as "your servant" to show that he respects Yahweh. This can be stated in first person. AT: "respect me, your servant, as I make this request" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pronouns]])
contextId.quote: respect this prayer of your servant and his request

contextId.information: These two words together emphasize that Yahweh will dwell in the temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that the person is sincere as he makes his request. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:27|8:28]]. AT: "requests" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean basically the same thing and refer to God's power. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your mighty hand, and your raised arm

contextId.information: The words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that the people are sincere as they make their request. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:27|8:28]]. AT: "their request" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The two words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing. Together they emphasize that the people were sincere as they made their request to Yahweh. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:27|8:28]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that he is sincere as he makes his request. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:27|8:28]]. AT: "request" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
These two phrases mean basically the same thing and emphasize Solomon's desire for Yahweh to be present with the people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "prayer" and "request" mean basically the same thing and emphasize that Yahweh recognized that Solomon's request was sincere. Similar words appear in [[:en:bible:notes:1ki:08:27|8:28]]. AT: "your request" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
Here the words "commandments" and "statutes" mean basically the same thing and emphasize all that Yahweh has commanded. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

The words "brothers" and "people of Israel" are a doublet that refer to the men of the ten northern tribes and emphasize the family relationship between them and the tribes of Judah and Benjamin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: your brothers the people of Israel

contextId.information: The words "served" and "worshiped" mean basically the same thing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
contextId.quote: He served Baal and worshiped him
